intro: Desmos mindorensis, commonly known as the Mindanao desmos, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland forests and is adapted to humid, tropical climates. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare species requiring conservation efforts.
